text: hari haraye namaḥ kṛṣṇa yādavāya namaḥ
translation: O Lord, Kṛṣṇa, Yādava, Hari, Mādhava, Keśava, again and again I offer my obeisance to You.
All glory to Gopāl, Govinda, Rām, Śrī Madhusūdan, Giridhārī, Gopīnāth, Madan Mohan!
All glory to Śrī Chaitanya, Nityānanda, Advaitachandra, Gadādhar, Śrivās, and all the Lord’s devotees!
All glory to Śrī Rūpa, Sanātan, Raghunāth Bhaṭṭa, Śrī Jīva, Gopāl Bhaṭṭa, and Raghunāth Dās!

text: ei chhaya gosāñi kari charaṇa vandana
translation: I offer my obeisance to these six goswāmīs. By doing so, all obstacles are destroyed and all desires are fulfilled.

text: ei chhaya gosāñi yā̐ra mu̐i tā̐ra dāsa
translation: I am a servant of these six goswāmīs. Their foot dust is my

text: tā̐dera charaṇa sevi bhakta sane vāsa
translation: To live with the devotees who serve their feet is my desire, birth after birth.

text: ei chhaya gosāñi yabe vraje kailā vāsa
translation: When these six goswāmīs lived in Vraja, they revealed Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa’s eternal Pastimes.
Joyfully chant, ‘Hari!’, and worship Vṛndāvan, meditating on the feet of Śrī Guru and the Vaiṣṇavas.
Aspiring for the lotus feet of Śrī Guru and the Vaiṣṇavas, Narottam Dās chants the Holy Name.
